headline: Our Best Cheesecake
description: This is our best recipe for cheesecake with a rich, creamy texture and cherry topping for a showstopping dessert that is also easy to make!
name: Our Best Cheesecake
recipeIngredient: 1.75 cups HONEY MAID Graham Cracker Crumbs
3 (8 ounce) packages PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, softened
1 cup BREAKSTONE'S or KNUDSEN Sour Cream

recipeInstructions.text: Mix graham crumbs, butter, and 1/4 cup sugar.
Press crumbs onto bottom of 9-inch springform pan.
Beat cream cheese and remaining sugar in large bowl with mixer until blended. Add sour cream and vanilla; mix well.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating on low speed after each addition just until blended.
Bake 1 hour to 1 hour 10 minutes, or until center is almost set. Run knife around rim of pan to loosen cake; cool before removing rim. Refrigerate cheesecake 4 hours.
Top with pie filling before serving.

review.reviewBody: This was the first time I had ever made a cheese cake from scratch. I searched through a good number of recipes and found this one using only 3 blocks of cream cheese. Which is all I had at the time. It turned out spectacular!
Made this for christmas. Tuned out great.

My Mom took her cheesecake recipe to the grave with her and the world (if you ask anyone who's tasted it) is a sadder place for it. This classic is a pretty darned close second and a winner in it's own right. The only change I make is to use 1 tsp each of vanilla and almond flavoring which is the only part of Mom's recipe that we can vouch for. Heavenly!
Best Cheesecake recipe. I first made it for my dad's birthday this year. Now it's my son's favorite so I had to make it for Thanksgiving. Followed recipe & didnt substitute!
Sure thing everytime, gave my daughter the recipe. I add just add tad more sugar to mix approx 1/2 cup more...PERFECTION❣️

This recipe is fantastic. I make it yearly for my husbands birthday and he says it's the best cheesecake he's ever had. Very creamy and delicious. Add a little cinnamon to the crust mix. Make a fruit (raspberry/strawberry, etc!) compote to go with it, don't get jarred cherries. People will rave about it.
I've made this recipe many times now!! Instead of using a springform pan like the recipe calls for, you can fill two 9-inch store-bought graham cracker crusts :)

I have made this for years and never had any complaints, people ask me to make it for them. So easy, absolutely no water bath required. Just follow directions. Excellent. Don’t try to fix what is already perfect.

This recipe was easy as stated and was delicious. Although the cake is quite large, I wouldn't count on serving 16 people. It would serve 10-12 small slices. I will definitely make this cheesecake again. No cracking and no water bath needed!

A man's perspective: Girlfriend and I made it. The recipe makes allot more than fits in one LARGE so called 9" spring form pan". So make an extra Gram Cracker crust and have TWO : )
Aren't two ALWAYS better than one ?
 Yes, two of the small 9" pans made two perfect Cheese cakes. See, one for me and split the other.

I read the reviews and made some changes. Baked the crust, used a little less sugar, baked at 325 in a water bath for 80 mins , left it in the oven with the door cracked open and it came out perfect and creamy with no breaks. Everyone loved it. Made a strawberry compote with frozen strawberries. Just delicious. Will make again!

This came out quite well. A little brown on top, but since it was my first attempt at making a cheesecake, I was still impressed. The only adjustment I made was an additional tsp of vanilla, which makes everything better.

This is my absolute go to recipe for cheesecake. It has never failed me. my secret to keep it from cracking is to bake it in a water bath and letting it set in the oven for about 45 minutes to cool a bit. Then refrigerate for at least 4 hours before cutting and serving.
Add a little lemon extract.

Fantastic recipe really really delicious! I preheated my oven to 1 hour and it almost came out burnt but I stopped it at 40 minutes so I would recommend to put the timer at 40 minutes so it is not burnt and if you want you can change the crust to something that stays compact (you can but its still amazing) because it comes apart when eating but other than that it is absolutely amazing! Really enjoyed it as a beginner and I would definitely recommend to try it.
Great recipe. Will use it forever. Made my kids extremely happy. It came out great.

Loved it. I topped it with lemon curd because I had so many lemons and it was a hit. Rich and delicious. The cake puffed up in the oven then dropped at the end. I didn't know cheesecake puffed up so much during baking process. Learn something new everyday!
Love this recipe. I substituted Monkfruit for sugar

Great recipe. Very light and fluffy but you need more info than the recipe tells you. 1) gram cracker crust should go in the oven for 10 min prior to baking with batter. 2) use cooking spray or butter or shortening on the sides of your spring form pan before adding batter. 3) when you beat cream cheese and sugar together, beat until you no longer feel the sugar granules in the batter, this could take ten min. This also allows air to get into the batter that will make it light and fluffy. 4) if using a 8-9 inch spring form pan, fill the pan to the top leaving 1/8 inch for it to rise a bit. 5) allow your cheese cake to cool slowly, after an hour turn off your oven and open the door about two inches leaving the cake in the oven to cool, about 15 min. Then leave on the stove top or counter top to cool 1/2 hour. Then place in fridge for two - three hours. This will prevent from cracking and keep your cake fluffy. Hope this helps. Do be bothered by the dark top layer it’s normal.
it was a hit! Came out creamy and the crust was delicious, unsalted butter was used and so easy to make.
All time favorite cheesecake! This is highly requested at all gatherings and holidays !

It's perfect! I only added 1 tablespoon of flour. 

Thank you you made my family happy!

I took the advice of other reviewers and preheated the Graham cracker crust at 300 degrees for 10 minutes. Then I baked everything in a water bath for 1 hour. After the hour, I turned off the oven and left the cake in with the door slightly ajar to cool gradually. Afterwards, I removed the springform ring and refrigerated it for 4 hours. It came out beautifully. A light crack on top, but perfect otherwise. You definitely need a springform pan to make this. Top it with strawberry compote, and this was the easiest cheesecake recipe!! I’ll definitely make it again.

This is the best cheesecake I have ever had! I did what on reviewer suggested and cooked the crust for 10 min before adding the batter and it was perfection!!! I have made this over a dozen times already. Family request that I make it now.
I did the bath method with this recipe and somehow water still got in under my tinfoil and no one cared because it was so good

Just put this in the oven....looked good even before cooked
Anxious to taste it. Very easy to whip up for a dinner party treat.
Yes

I've made this twice and about to do one for my daughter and her boyfriend and one for home family loves this simple easy recipe and tastes great. This time I'm making strawberry and adding a few strawberries to the cream cheese filling.

I have made this 3 times. I read the comments and saw many pictures and to those giving this recipe a bad review... here's what you did wrong.. because I did the same thing.:
1. You HAVE to let your cold ingredients come to room temp.
2. A water bath isn't necessary (especially if you use a little cornstarch) but it bakes the cheesecake very delicately adding to the creamy smooth texture. All you need is a larger pan and fill with a few inches of water and set your springform pan inside.
3. Do Not overcook. Actually, once the outside starts to puff up a little and the center is still a little giggly (like jello) you can stop baking, otherwise, you will burn/crack the top.
3. Cool GRADUALLY! Otherwise you will crack the top. Leave sit in the oven for an hour with the oven turned off. Then remove from water bath (if you did this step) and let cool Completely on top of stove. Then refrigerate for 6 hours or ideally, overnight. If you try eating before it is completely set and cold... it will taste like quiche-cake... instead of delicious cheesecake. Anyway, after seeing and tasting it the first time... I had to see what I did wrong.. which was almost everything. With that being said, I now feel like I can open my own Cheesecake Factory. lol There is a science to it and you CANNOT rush the cheesecake process at all. Or any baking process for that matter. 

This recipe is amazing and everyone I shared this with LOVED it. I even have interested buyers!
Used an already made shell and only one egg. Other than that followed exactly. This cake is phenomenal!

I think it's a great recipe. 
Easy to make and taste awesome. 
I have made it blueberries, raspberries, strawberries and coconut. 
I also use a lemon cream cheese frosting that I got off of Allrecipes, throw some homemade pomegranate jam in the frosting.

Added more vanilla. There was so much batter I also made 4 ramekin cakes. Definitely make ur own crust. I used a premade & the ramekins with the recipe's crust was sooo much better. Also, if this is ur 1st cheesecake (like me), YouTube what a done cheesecake looks & jiggles like. I almost overcooked mine.
Mine came out horrible, though I followed the recipe. Maybe I cooked it too long. It still shouldnt have tasted that bad.
Taste is fine but the recipe didn't tell you what temp to cook it at or that a water bath is NECESSARY!!! super stupid and annoying

For all those wondering what they did wrong or why they have too much filling, this recipe is made for a 9 inch SPRINGFORM pan, not a 9 inch ready made graham cracker pie pan. I added homemade triple chocolate brownies to my mix at the end and drizzled with homemade caramel sauce in top for my lady's birthday, perfect.
I followed the recipe using store brand graham cracker, cream cheese and sour cream. And i did not use the cherry topping. It taste delicious by itself. Imagine if you use superior ingredient.
Turned out great! No cracking and no water base needed!
Recipe turned out great. Wish the cake was thicker but I plan to double the recipe next time

This cheesecake recipe is simple to follow and turns out great with a few minor tweaks! I did as other reviewers did and prebaked the crust for 10 minutes at 300. Made the final product stable and able to stand up to the cheesecake! When I put the cake into the oven I baked it for 10 minutes at 350 and then dropped the temp to 300 and added a water bath! Hour later I had a jiggly cheesecake that hit the necessary temp and into the fridge it went! Pulled it out and it is AMAZING! Color is spot on and texture is light and airy! I'm not crazy about cheesecake but I'll gladly help eat this one!

A simple cheesecake recipe that makes a great cake. 

What I added

-extra graham crackers for more crust on the side. I added more butter and sugar to the crumb mixer. 

-I pre set my crust by baking it for 10 mins at 300°

-I reduced my heat throughout baking my cake. Started at 350°, half way mark 300°, then finally 200° at 20 mins left. I also allowed my cake to cool in the oven. I think reducing the heat and allowing ample cool time prevented cracks from forming.

This cheesecake is my new go to! Everyone lives it! It’s fluffier than regular New York cheesecake but still as rich. The sour cream adds a little tartness that makes this recipe unique. Wonderful flavor with or without fruit! I’m getting ready to make it for the third time in 2 months.
I'm not a fan of cheesecake but this.... took the cake!! pun intended

Wish tips for us “first-timers” had been included. I learned the hard way - no water bath, over mixed, too high of a rise, so it caved in. Hopefully it’s not gritty and at least tastes good tomorrow. Kinda sad about it all.

Amazing recipe, this is the first time i've ever made cheesecake and it came out beautifully. I did put it in a bath, and covered outside of springboard pan with foil. Also cracked open oven and let cool before i took it out. Thanks!
Me and my family decided to make it during quarantine, it had just enough batter and I’m the texture was perfect.
My first cheesecake and this recipe was so easy and delicious. Everyone told me to “save that recipe!”
It is a lovely recipe. Was in a hurry so I used canned pie filling for the topping and this worked fine. Next time, I will try to use sour cherries.

This recipe produced a smooth, not too sweet, delightfully easy cheesecake. I usually use a different recipe from my mom, but did not have it at my second residence. I was a little reluctant to try a different one, but was extremely happy with this.....Try it, you will like it! I forgot to take a picture and it was eaten too swiftly. I did follow the recipe and I also used a water bath to bake it and followed another suggestion to bake at a lower temp then left it in oven to cool.

I made this and it was amazing. I baked the crust at 350° for about 10 minutes. Then mixed well all the ingredients. I did add about a teaspoon of lemon juice. I had a water bath under the cake and baked it for 10 minutes at 350° and then lowered the temperature to 300° for 40 minutes. I cracked the oven door and turned the oven off for the next 15/20 minutes. It turned out perfect, creamy smooth just a little brown on the edge. We all thought it was as good as any restaurant.
I followed the recipe exactly and it turned out perfect

This is a wonderful recipe! I've seen a few comments from others who are disappointed that the cheesecake sank after coming out of the oven. 

Some tips: be sure to not overmix when you add the eggs. It helps to whisk them a little before adding them to the batter. Overwhipped eggs will lead to a deflated cheesecake. Also, when your cheesecake is almost done baking, its a great idea to turn off your oven and crack the oven door open with a wooden spoon to allow the cheesecake to slowly stop cooking and eventually cool in the oven. This will prevent the cracking on top (which is usually caused by the drastic change of temperature from oven to countertop). I hope this helps!
Stupid easy to make!
This is the same recipe on the back of the box of the Honey Maid graham cracker crumbs box.
Thank you so much for posting this!! I made it and oh my goodness it is amazing and easy to do! I always struggle making cheesecake but this recipe is my favorite!!!

This is a great cheesecake. I followed the recipe as written, except for the crust. You need a 9” springform pan. You’ve done something wrong if your pan overflows. As for the crust, I found a shortbread cookie recipe (crushed cookies, butter, and sugar). The crust went great with this cake. I will definitely make this again!!

It turned out great. I cooked for 10 minutes first under 350 degrees than for 50 minutes under 300 degrees. I also prebaked the crust for 10 minutes first and let it cool while I made the filling. I also cooked it in the oven in a water bath. Let it cool in oven for 1 hour with oven door closed. Then an additional 2 1/2 hours before placing in the fridge for 3 hours.
Made this with 3 large eggs instead. Turned out delicious

Hands down the best recipe ever!! My cheesecakes cone out so smooth and silky and perfect every time. No cracks Or no ugly dark coloring.. I made my crust out of honey wheat ritz crackers and I made a homemade walnut caramel sauce. Absolutely phenomenal recipe!!
This turned out great! I did it all according to the recipe and had no issues. Might try a little extra sour cream next time for a touch more moisture.
Best cheesecake ever! Filled the ore made crust with 2 extra servings, and had extra left for a 4 inch springform one.
It may have been your best but I fell flat. It was really blah. I followed the recipe completely. I’m going to try it again to see if it was my luck.

I did not like this cheese cake one bit. Followed recipe exactly. Turned out brown and cracked on top, rose up several inches during cooking and then went flat after being removed from the oven. The flavor was not good. I did not taste anything resembling cheesecake and found it to be too bland. The only thing I actually could taste was eggs. Maybe if the cream cheese was increased and the eggs were decreased it would taste better.
Made it exactly as written. It was better the next day, but not sweet enough. I won't make it again.

I loved this! Added some Godiva chocolate chips! Going too make it again today with blueberry preserves. The only thing I will change this go around is the cooking time. It came out a little more golden than I would have liked. Still very tasty!

High altitude: after 45 mins, reduce heat to 325 add 15 mins cook time. My top cracked. Wish i would have done the water bath. Taste was fabulous. I skipped the cherries and went with flavored caramel.

I had been making another cheesecake on this site for the past two years and decided to try this. Absolutely the best. I decided to take the flavor profile and change it to lemon so I added some lemon juice instead of vanilla to the filling. Will definitely make again.
I made it. Everyone LOVES IT!!! didn't change a thing!!Easy to make and turns out perfect every time!!

This is the recipe that started it all. Before this, everything I ever made came from a box.
But I've come a long way in the last 4 weeks!
I've made this 4 times already!
I failed miserably my first attempt. Butter from the crust leaked out of the bottom of my new Springform pan & dripped down onto the heating elements in the oven. Before I knew what happened, there was thick black smoke everywhere!
That was Christmas Eve.
The next day I saw the most amazing thing...
A recipe for
MINI Cheesecakes!
No springforn pan!

Bottom line, I use this recipe (minus the topping) but I put them in muffin tins.
Outstanding!!!!!!
(Seriously, they're freaking amazing! And soooo easy!)
Love love this recipe
Followed the recipe it tuned out great!
Easy and delicious.. was a huge hit!

First time I made this I had left over cheesecake. It was also a brown color on the top. The 2nd time I made it with the little bit of left over cheesecake and cut the recipe in half. I also put the temperature to 350. No brown on top and lush and thick!
Easy and so good
It was easy to make but it came out very fluffy. I like a more heavier cheesecake. I will definitely make it again

My granddaughter can’t eat gluten, so I made a gluten free crust with almond flour. We skipped the topping because it was delicious without it! 
I’m sure it would be great with the topping, too. 
It was very easy to make compared to other cheesecakes I’ve made.
Yes I used the 1/3 less cream cheese however it must be room temp to mix well with sugar. I also used a 10 inch spring pan so I had to make a bit more crust.

Easy to make and fit perfectly in a 9” SPRINGFORM pan. Next time I will add some cinnamon to the crust, or use Oreos, just because I like to change things up. It turned out great and everyone loved it. I was even short on time and had to speed up the cooling and it still came out great.
Was excellent I made 3 of them at same time. Two of them I used the water bath and there were no cracks. I had only one crack on the one that did not have water bath. Extremely good flavor.
Excellent!! Def make again! My daughter is allergic to gluten so I used pre-made GF graham crust and had extra filling I just baked crustless. Will def make again, thank you!
Perfect
easy to make, to get the middle to set, the crust was a little overdone, but family liked it.
I loved this recipe and my family loved it, too! It was my first attempt at a cheesecake and I will continue to make this throughout the holidays!

First time baking a cheesecake and it turned out amazing! I followed some of the other reviewers and baked the crust for 10 mins at 300 before adding the filling. I also baked the cheesecake in a waterbath for 10 mins at 350 and turned the temp down to 300 for the remainder of the hour. Got no cracks!
My family loves pecans and I had some extra gram cracker crumbs so I added the extra to top its off. I will definitely make this every year.
Made for Thanksgiving! Was a hit with everyone.
So good. I actually used chocolate graham crackers and made cupcake sized. Note: takes less time than full cheesecake (about 45-50 minutes)
REALLY EASY. TASTE AND TEXTURE WAS PERFECT.
Only change I made was I added just a teaspoon of lemon flavor
I got soo many compliments when I made it!
Awesome love cheesecake especially made from scratch.

Will make again, never made cheesecake before and it was amazing, silky smooth and tasty! Used less sugar in the crust by 1/2 and added cinnamon as well. Ensured the sour cream and cream cheese were at room temperature. Lightly beat the eggs and folded in to be safe. Cooked the crust at 350 for 15min and then cooked the cake for 1hr15min at 300. Center 2in diameter should be jiggly and you don’t want any browning so you have to use a water bath for that even cooking. The whole family had multiple servings over a few days.
Super easy and delicious

I made this cheesecake for an impromptu Labor Day party. Everyone was amazed that it was so easy to make. Sadly, there were no leftovers to take home. But we all suffered through eating this delicious cheesecake. I made a strawberry sauce & had whipped cream in case anyone wanted to embellish their piece.

The first time I made it, it came out fantastic. Today I've made it about 5 times with rave reviews. Although one person said the cake was grainy and that I should not have added milk. Clearly she didn't know what she was talking about because the recipe has no milk.

After searching for a cheesecake recipe, I thought I'd try it since it had a 5 star rating. Don't waste your money on making this it was horrible!! No flavor , the texture was weird, sort of like custard, not creamy at all!! I suppose if you have never had cheesecake you might think this is good, taste nothing like cheesecake. I'll keep searching for a recipe!

Turned out perfectly. Like someone else said on here, let your ingredients come up to room temperature to avoid lumps. If your graham crackers have honey in them already, you may not need to add too much sugar to the crust. I prebaked my crust at 300 for 10 minutes. Baked the cheesecake at 350 for 10 minutes and then at 300 for 50. Left it to cool in the oven with the door open and then put it in the fridge. No cracking whatsoever and I didn't even use a water bath! Delicious with a strawberry sauce.
The texture was like scramble eggs. It came out somewhat curdled.
Good. Next time I will reduce the sugar in the crust.
I have very little experience baking and this was simple and amazing!
